intro: Mercurialis triandra, commonly known as the three-lobed mercury plant, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in a cyathium, a unique floral structure typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Mercurialis triandra is also known for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
